detail.content: Future Dancers & Dancemakers - High School Program : Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Dance Chair's Message / Social Undergraduate Graduate Course Offerings News & Events Performances Dance & New Media Live Summer High School Second Avenue Dance Company Alumni Current Students Admin & Faculty  home > Dance > Summer High School        Future Dancers & Dancemakers High School Program  SATURDAY INTENSIVE    The Department of Dance at New York University, Tisch School of the Arts is host to the Future Dancers and Dancemakers FREE Spring intensive workshop. The workshop mentored by Tisch Professors identifies talented and highly motivated high school dancers and dancemakers to participate in a comprehensive 14-week program. Designed to support and enhance their current training, participants will engage in many of the components that comprise the BFA program at Tisch Dance. Fifteen young artists will be selected to participate in this free program which is held for 14 Saturdays from February to May. Applicants, in their freshmen, sophomore, and junior year, from the five boroughs of New York City, as well as from Westchester County, Long Island, New Jersey, Connecticut, and Philadelphia are encouraged to apply.    The workshop is two-fold; providing exposure to the Tisch Dance Program while simultaneously reflecting an intensive environment mirroring that of the professional field through:       Concentration on technical training    Creative discussions to support the choreographic work and creative process    Discussions with professional choreographers and Tisch faculty    APPLICATION INFORMATION    The deadline to submit your completed application, along with your recommendations and transcript, is December 1, 2014 .       Applicants must demonstrate:       Strong technical foundation in dance and choreography    Academic achievement    Ability to work in collaboration with other young artists    A firm commitment to completing the entire workshop, which will be held on fourteen Saturdays from February through May    Fifteen students will be selected after review of application materials and an interview.    CURRICULUM    Future Dancers and Dancemakers, similar to Tisch Dance, focuses on technical training, choreography, and performance. Students take two technique classes daily, one each of ballet and modern. All students will also study dance composition, improvisation, and repertory. The workshop will produce a final concert of student work created over the 14-week intensive.    FACULTY    Future Dancers and Dancemakers (FDD) will be taught by Tisch Dance second year MFA candidates. The graduate teaching candidates that participate in FDD are experienced teachers, performers, and choreographers. As distinguished MFA candidates from all over the country they explore their distinct voices to share their knowledge in their specific area of interest. Each graduate teaching candidate must exhibit a special interest in pedagogy and are mentored by one or more faculty members of Tisch Dance.    For more information please contact the Dance department at future.dancemakers@nyu.edu or call (212) 998-1980.    APPLY HERE   Click here to go to our Facebook group! Summer Dance Festival: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Dance Chair's Message / Social Undergraduate Graduate Course Offerings News & Events Performances Dance & New Media Live Summer High School Second Avenue Dance Company Alumni Current Students Admin & Faculty  home > Dance        Tisch Dance Summer Festival  Summer 2015 Residency Festival  Study With Innovative Contemporary Choreographers  Residency I: May 26 - June 13 Residency II: June 15 - July 2  The Department of Dance at Tisch School of the Arts offers two intensive three-week workshops to serve the intermediate-to-advanced dance student who is preparing to enter the profession. Students may participate in the program for either three or six weeks and will study with a minimum of three different companies in each session while being exposed to the workings of the other companies.    The program is based on strong technical training, achieved by concentrating on the healthy and efficient use of the body to realize each person’s physical potential, and the development of the imaginative and creative elements of each individual. To this end, we integrate the instruction from Tisch’s permanent faculty of master teachers with that of major guest artists and company members. More  Undergraduate Admission Requirements The Department of Dance seeks exceptionally talented students who can commit themselves to the rigors of professional study. More Apply NYU More Dance Audition In addition to the written application, an audition and interview are required.
